biography:
One of New York’s most notable ska bands, the Slackers formed in Brooklyn in 1991 and have played the world over many times since. Their first release was an eponymous self-released album, distributed by Moon Records in 1993 on cassette. Their first real debut is “Better Late Than Never” on moon ska records. Coming out in 1996, this album saw a movement to more traditional ska music, as opposed to their earlier two-tone and garage influences. It was produced by Victor Rice, a noted ska/reggae producer, who also played bass for them at one point.

Band members are as follows:
Vic Ruggiero - Keyboards, Vocals
Jay “Agent Jay” Nugent - Guitar
Dave Hillyard - Saxophone
Glen Pine - Trombone, Vocals
Marcus Geard - Bass
Ara Babajian - Drums
name: The Slackers

theaudiodb.biography_en:
One of New York’s most notable ska bands, the Slackers formed in Brooklyn in 1991 and have played the world over many times since. Their first release was an eponymous self-released album, distributed by Moon Records in 1993 on cassette. Their first real debut is “Better Late Than Never” on moon ska records. Coming out in 1996, this album saw a movement to more traditional ska music, as opposed to their earlier two-tone and garage influences. It was produced by Victor Rice, a noted ska/reggae producer, who also played bass for them at one point.

Band members are as follows:
Vic Ruggiero - Keyboards, Vocals
Jay “Agent Jay” Nugent - Guitar
Dave Hillyard - Saxophone
Glen Pine - Trombone, Vocals
Marcus Geard - Bass
Ara Babajian - Drums
theaudiodb.biography_fr: L'un des groupes de ska les plus remarquables de New York, les Slackers se sont formés à Brooklyn en 1991 et ont joué dans le monde entier à plusieurs reprises depuis. Leur première sortie était un album auto-publié éponyme, distribué par Moon Records en 1993 sur cassette. Leur premier vrai début est "Better Late Than Never" sur les disques de moon ska. Sorti en 1996, cet album a vu un mouvement vers une musique ska plus traditionnelle, par opposition à leurs influences bicolores et garage antérieures. Il a été produit par Victor Rice, un célèbre producteur de ska/reggae, qui a également joué de la basse pour eux à un moment donné.
theaudiodb.name: The Slackers

lastfm.bio_content: One of New York's most notable ska bands, the Slackers formed in Brooklyn in 1991 and have played the world over many times since. Their first release was an eponymous self-released album, distributed by Moon Records in 1993 on cassette. Their first real debut is "Better Late Than Never" on Moon Ska Records. Coming out in 1996, this album saw a movement to more traditional ska music, as opposed to their earlier two-tone and garage influences. It was produced by Victor Rice, a noted ska/reggae producer, who also played bass for them at one point. Band members are as follows: Vic Ruggiero - Keyboards, Vocals Jay "Agent Jay" Nugent - Guitar Dave Hillyard - Saxophone Glen Pine - Trombone, Vocals Marcus Geard - Bass Ara Babajian - Drums Former members and contributors: Marq "Q-Maxx 4:20" Lyn - Vocals TJ Scanlon - Guitar Luis "Zulu" Zuluaga - Drums Jeremy "Mush One" Mushlin - Trumpet, Vocals Allen Teboul - Drums Dunia Best- Vocals, Flute Jeff "King Django" Baker - Trombone Tobias Fields - Congas Eric "E-ROC" Singer - Alto Saxophone Victor Rice - Bass Dave Hahn - lead guitar Justin Redekop- Trumpet The next album released was Redlight, on HellCat Records in 1997. This album solidified their sound and further fixed the line-up. The band released its latest album, entitled Self Medication, in May of 2008. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
